name: 'Toy Story' First Lines Quiz | Toy Story (1995) . | 10 Questions

questions.correct: 'Ages 3 and up'! It's on my box, 'Ages 3 and up'!
options: All right, everyone -- this is a stickup.
Whatta ya lookin' at, ya hockey puck?
questions.explanation:
'Ages 3 and up'! It's on my box, 'Ages 3 and up'!.

	He's complaining about being handed to baby Molly to play with, who proceeds to slobber on him and tear him apart. (This is a bad example set by {Disney;} Potato Head toys are indeed not for babies.) The stickup line is actually said by Andy.

I don't get it.

	He doesn't understand Potato Head's Picasso reference when PH arranges his features crazily.

options: Come in, Mother Bird. This is Alpha Bravo.
questions.explanation:
Sir, no, sir!.

	He says this when Woody asks him if he knows where Slinky is.

questions.correct: I wanted to thank you, Woody, for saving my flock.
options: I'm just a couple of blocks away.
Stop it! Stop it, you mean old potato!
questions.explanation:
I wanted to thank you, Woody, for saving my flock.

	She yanks Woody to her with her staff.

questions.correct: All right, everyone -- this is a stickup.
options: You've saved the day again, Woody!
questions.explanation:
All right, everyone -- this is a stickup.

	Technically, Andy says this, even though he was vocalizing for One-eyed Bart (Potato Head).

options: I'm just coming off as annoying.
questions.explanation:
ROAR!.

	He tries to scare Woody with a half-hearted roar.

questions.correct: Yes! Ha ha ha ha ha..
options: You got a brain in there?
questions.explanation:
Yes! Ha ha ha ha ha..

	He's laughing as he's torturing Combat Carl, just before he blows him up with an M-80.

options: Local law enforcement; it's about time you got here.
questions.explanation:
Buzz Lightyear to Star Command...

	Of course, he gets no reply.

questions.correct: Pull my string! The birthday party's today!?
questions.explanation:
Pull my string! The birthday party's today!?.

	After he finds out that Andy's mom has scheduled Andy's birthday party early.
